materials_name: albumen (egg white protein) albumen paper paper (fiber product)
physical_appearance: This is a photograph of the marble baradari pavillion in Lahore. In the photograph, there is a clearing with a path leading up to the building. The building is a two-leveled pavillion, with pillars supporting three arches. There is a fence behind the building. There are no individuals in the photograph. The title is written at the bottom, below the photograph.
title_text: Photograph album of views and portraits in the Punjab, Cashmere, Ceylon, Burma, Penang, Singapore, and Java Marble Baradari, Hooseini Bagh, Lahore
subject_terms_2: Photographs Thomson, J. (John), 1837-1921 Lahore (Pakistan) Pavilions Arches Architecture, Mogul Empire
